Alexis Dumas Homepage

      Hi, I’m Alexis

      Welcome to my home page! This is where you can find information about who I am, targeted at future employers, so if you want to get to know me a little, read on…

      Resume Github

      Photo credit: Pixabay

      I am a computer science major, currently working on my Bachelor’s at Penn State University, class of 2023. Getting a job in the tech industry has been my lifelong goal, and I’ve been programming since a very young age. My side hobbies include reading science fiction and fantasy, and writing both fiction and non-fiction. Some of my strengths are:

      Photo by Yan Krukov from Pexels

      Communication

      I consider myself to be very good at communicating things to people across a wide range of disciplines and specialities. Clear and precise writing is one of my strengths.

      Photo credit: Kevin Ku from Pexels

      Productivity

      I am committed to writing clear, readable, and well-structured code, but even so I am able to complete required features quickly and efficiently.

      Photo credit: Fauxels

      Works Well With Others

      Everyone says this out of necessity, but in my case I really believe that it is true: I work well with others, and enjoy working as part of a team. I am good at coordination, and will naturally step up to fill leadership roles when necessary and acceptable.

      Photo credit: Pixabay

      Flexibility

      I’ve worked with a lot of technology, both for school and on side projects. That includes web development technology, such as Node.JS, React, Redux, Ember.JS, Firebase, and TypeScript, as well as back-end technologies, including Go, Python, and Java, and systems programming langauges such as Rust and C++. I’ve learned that once you undertand the basic underlying concepts of programming, one can rapidly adapt to the requirements of any job.

      See some of my projects

      Photo by Christina Morillo from Pexels

      Empathy

      I enjoy helping others with their problems, and am more than willing to go out of my way to establish relationships of mutual benefit and trust wherever possible. I have found that a focus on only my own benefit and tasks leads to worse outcomes for myself and for others in the long run.

      Look Promising?

      Now that you know more about me, if you’re interested, you can contact me using my email. To avoid confusion, please note that my email address still uses my deadname. Please use she/her pronouns. Thank you!
